...and especially for legislation in crisis. We need to learn to #skipthepork and stop using a crisis for pet projects that we can't get passed otherwise.

As I sit on the floor of the House today listening to colleague after colleague say "this bill is not perfect" and "I'll support this bill because of the crisis,  but it has many flaws" - I again urge my colleagues to consider #singleissuebills for all future legislation
Debate continues on the House floor.  Thank you to all our frontline healthcare workers! https://t.co/A7ygGIcfzR

The Senate “emergency” bill allows sanctuary cities to receive Justice Department grants that were stopped by the Trump administration. Sanctuary jurisdictions should not get federal money-and this is NOT related to the Coronavirus economic crisis.  #singleissuebills #skipthepork https://t.co/r7hzmFtlGh

The Senate bill gives $75 million in “emergency” funding to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting-funding which lasts til September 2021. Give me a break!! #skipthepork #singleissuebills https://t.co/qerxrVuzXA
Over $1 billion for Amtrak in the Senate “emergency” bill? #skipthepork This is why we need #singleissuebills https://t.co/NB86YFknZH

The Senate decided to include $25 million in “emergency funding” for the Kennedy Performing Arts Center...even though it remains closed until at least May 10th. Really?? #skipthepork #singleissuebills https://t.co/TgLeYEEyD5

Speaker Pelosi knows that we should be debating the merits of a corporate minimum wage and employee selected board memberships in a separate bill.  This is not related to an emergency Coronavirus response #singleissuebills https://t.co/a5fLaEME7v

In Speaker Pelosi’s bill, only two colleges (out of thousands, both just happening to be in DC, and both private) were named to get a $20 million handout. Neither associated with COVID more than any other college. Thats the definition of an earmark. #singleissuebills #skipthepork https://t.co/8y7C0KMJaS

A totally new program to spend millions on expensive “renewable” jet fuel??? Only another $200 million under Speaker Pelosi’s “emergency” coronavirus bill. #skipthepork #singleissuebills https://t.co/Ka4OWellIA

This is really unbelievable. It’s on page 803 of the Speaker’s bill.  If Speaker Pelosi destroys the economy, she won’t have to worry about getting the airline emissions part of the Green New Deal into the COVID-19 bill. That’s why we need #singleissuebills https://t.co/wBjYAOdX4I

Requiring each bill to be on a single issue will be the only way to stop pork and let every member be able to tell their constituents what they truly support or don’t support. #skipthepork #singleissuebills

I’m all for helping hard-working Americans and restarting the economy asap, but we need to change how bills are written and passed so they are simplified,  transparent, and accountable. #skipthepork #singleissuebills

What does nullifying the President’s exec order on federal employee union issues have to do with COVID-19?  We have small businesses going out of business, and this is a priority for the coronavirus crisis? It’s on page 737 of Speaker Pelosi’s bill! #singleissuebills #skipthepork https://t.co/9diWCMyZVu
This is why we need #singleissuebills!!  What does selling spectrum on page 996 of the Speaker Pelosi bill have to do with coronavirus?? #skipthepork https://t.co/flaqi59MaX

No voter ID to get a ballot, and anonymous “ballot harvesting”...why is that hidden in Speaker Pelosi’s coronavirus bill? These are issues that shouldn’t be addressed at this time. #singleissuebills https://t.co/SjV2V15Qeu
From Pelosi’s 1,119 page COVID-19 Bill - what does forcing all states to have early voting have to do with coronavirus? #singleissuebills https://t.co/12AGe8n1bQ
#singleissuebills #skipthepork https://t.co/J0jHA3Jwn2

I still have serious concerns with the Senate bailout bill being considered-and now its possible that if the bill comes to the House there may not even be debate on a $2 trillion package!  Not the way to do the nation’s business. Why not break up such a large bill? #skipthepork

Today we remember the legacy and sacrifice of Dr. Martin Luther King. His unfailing love for his fellow Americans was a tremendous example for all, and his efforts to ensure equal rights for all have made us a more perfect union.
